author: lightclient
content: Does anyone care about picking gas limit vs. gas target? After EIP-1559, gas limit became a second order effect of the chosen target multiplied by the elasticity parameter. Feels more natural choose a gas target in that case. But in reality, many people are only aware of the gas limit?

author: timbeiko
content: <@543900561460822016> I would try and mimic what clients pick (IIRC, the gas limit), so that there aren't two types of parameters passed around by different actors

author: timbeiko
content: you don't want to accidentally send a value that's 2x higher/lower than what you meant because the other thing you're interacting with interprets it as target instead of limit or vice versa.

author: ralexstokes
content:
let's assume we are in a world with multiple relays who are all well-connected (in a networking sense) to a diverse set of block builders

when i query my known relays in `mev-boost` i get back many headers in this world and can pick the most valuable one

i can signal my selection (i only get one) by building the rest of the block around it and releasing my signature to the relay that sent me the header

i have a question about the data flow here -- should i try to submit the signed block to _every_ relay i know about, or just the *single* relay that should have the rest of the payload waiting for me?

author: ralexstokes
content: if i am one of these other relays i will get a blinded block and still need to go fetch the rest of it from somewhere, but there is somewhat better availability here, esp if i can go to my peered relays and fetch a full block if i can provide a valid signature

author: ralexstokes
content: otherwise, it would be on the validator to interact w/ this one relay and then the validator and the relay are responsible for full block dissemination on the usual channels
